title: @RIOT Today EA closed the Dawngate, Riot please be a pal to Waystone Games. PLEASE RIOT!
body: Today EA closed one of my favorite MOBA's, Dawngate. It was a well designed game albeit some issues, and a possible competitor to League given time. However, EA wasn't interested in giving it the  time to grow and has cancel development. With the canceling of Dawngate also comes the dissolving of Waystone games, and reassignment. The folks over at Waystone are talented, hard working, passionate, and dedicated people. They know MOBA's and have the skills and knowledge to be successful given the opportunity.  Riot, these developer deserve better then to end up doing soulless EA MEGACORP work and they would fit right in with the Riot crowd. If you have openings in any of positions, PLEASE reach out and grab the Waystone Games staff.

Why is everyone saying fuck EA? The game has been in development for over 3 years now and its barely out of BETA. 

With the rising popularity of Dota 2, SMITE going to consoles, and Blizzard already in BETA with their MOBA.....EA saw no profit in the game now that the market got saturated.

As a publisher, EA could have advertised the shit out of that game.  They didn't bother.  Look at all the advertisments on YouTube that HiRez, Blizzard, and Riot have been doing.  EA didn't give one flying fuck.  The market has been going into saturation mode for a while, HOTS didn't make EA pull the plug, "free to play" and "EA" just mix together like a Garen ultimate and a Zilean Chronoshift.

No, the timeline passed for Dawngate to be profitable.  If you don't think a 4 year timeline for a game to reach just open BETA is a good model then do not try to partner with big companies or try to make profitable games. The end goal is profit, if more money is going into the game than EA can see from profitable....its time to cut loses.

HOTS will be the end of the MOBA boom, because once Blizzard makes the game...no game that isn't already established will compete with the monolith.  With HotS being in BETA now, and Dawngate still in open BETA......that window is closing fast. There isnt room for Dawngate to grow and nothing ground-breaking to draw attention to it.

What was EA's chances to have Dawngate to be successful in the 2015+ MOBA market? It has a cult following, yes.....but it doesn't have the dedicated fanbase of the bigger MOBAs or even SMITE. It isn't planning anything drastic (AKA SMITE being the first console-based MOBA).

Oh well, it had a so far really interessting Lore - which stood out amongst competitors and on the long run could have easily interessted enough people in the game and also bound them to the game...especially with the recent decissions of Riot to just tell anyone interessted in "Leagues"-Lore to go and fuck themselves (yea, sorry for the harsh words, but that´s what i got from the few replies we got from riot regarding the retcon).
The gameplay hadn´t been brilliant yet, but solid enough to eventually get there.

And from seeing ther HOTS-Alpha i can tell you...this is far from dethroning anyone, and there aren´t as much Blizzard-fanboys anymore that blindly buy everything they sell to make it a "monolith" despite average gameplay and many flaws.
I really hope Blizzard sort of falls over in defeat. It's been losing steam and seems to only be appealing to their diehard fans.

oh well, they created some fantastic universes and I would not want for them to just fall over. 
But I really hope they´ll reconsider their course and go back to just producing good games in the first place without keeping constantly in mind how to milk the most money out of them.

Except that HoTS is terrible. Too many snowballing mechanics, none of the innovations are good for the genre. Why would you link the teams XP together and remove gold, making it so youre even MORE reliant on your entire team doing well or losing. in LoL a feeder means the enemy adc will be fed, in HoTS that same feeder means the entire enemy team is several levels above you and theres no way to bring it back. God help you if the enemy team secures the Raven objective making all your minions have 1 hp and turning off your towers.

For every Daikatana there's a Team Fortress 2.  And like I said, it's got less to do with business and windows of time, and more to do with the fact that EA can't imagine living in a world where they give shit away for free.  They'd much rather do what Blizzard does and double-dip with a monthly subscription fee and micro-transactions.  They knew that the "cult following" wouldn't allow such a travesty, so they pulled the plug.  The way your game is successful is by standing out.  DOTA has the "HARDEST ARTS EVA U GUIZE and eSports scene" LoL has the "pioneer of eSports", Smite has the "3rd person view and sky ganks", HOTS has "multiple maps and fully objective focused gameplay and for a casual crowd", Strife is "baby's first ARTS" and Dawngate had its lore.  And if you think a lore can't sell a game, I'll point you to the Elder Scrolls series.
